attributes.action: Cyclists fined for not using the designated lines
attributes.additional_details: Due to the client of engineering the lines allocated to them by the government, which has taken a large area of ​​the street for their account and the huge cost of the project, they never use it. Car owners should have the right as they have the right
attributes.background: They should be fined for not using their lines

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Cyclists are not legally required to use cycle lanes. You can read more in Rule 63 here

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/the-highway-code/rules-for-cyclists-59-to-82

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, such as requiring cyclists to use cycle lanes when provided.
